intro: Ouratea elegans, commonly known as the elegant ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. Ouratea elegans is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
